name: I Remember Mama Quiz | Authors | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
Nels.

	In the beginning and again at the end Katrin says, "Nels was the oldest and only boy." In the original Broadway production Nels was played by veteran actor Marlon Brando. The show opened on Broadway in 1944.

questions.text: What street do the main characters live on in San Francisco?
questions.explanation:
Steiner Street.

	The older people in the show are all from Norway. The children were all born in San Francisco where the show takes place. The adults do not pick up the San Francisco dialect even after all these years.

questions.text: What is the name of Dagmar's cat?
questions.explanation:
Elizabeth.

	Later on it is revealed that Elizabeth is actually a tomcat so the father suggests he gets called Uncle Elizabeth after that.

questions.text: Who does Aunt Trina want to marry?
questions.explanation:
Peter Thorkelson.

	Peter works at a funeral parlor and is a very timid man. They end up getting married and having a child together.

questions.text: Who does Katrin tell Uncle Chris is the bossy aunt?
questions.explanation:
Jenny.

	Marta is not one of their aunts. She is Mama. After this, Christine says that she likes Sigrid the least because she whines too much.

questions.text: What does Mama tell Katrin she has back in Norway?
questions.explanation:
a brother.

	Mama tells her that when she was 18 she had a little boy, so Katrin has a brother. The baby died when he was only two years old.

questions.text: Dagmar says she hasn't seen her cat in more than a month. Where had she been?
options: home, but the cat ran away
questions.explanation:
hospital.

	Dagmar had a problem with her ear which put her in the hospital for a month.

questions.text: How much does Mr. Hyde give a check for when he leaves?
questions.explanation:
$110.

	It turns out that Mr. Hyde's check is no good. However, Mama tears up the check and tells Jenny that Mr. Hyde did pay with something better than money. This is in reference to the set of books that Mr. Hyde has left the family.

Uncle Chris.

	Almost everyone is scared of Uncle Chris because he is so loud and forceful. The children find out when he's alive that he loves children and isn't as scary as they first thought. The aunts learn after he dies that he loved children and gave his money to helping children who may have been lame if it weren't for the medical treatment he provided.

questions.text: Which of the daughters wrote the "book" (that is the one in the play) about Mama?
questions.explanation:
Katrin.

	Trina is not one of the daughters, she is an aunt. Katrin throughout the play tells about her memory of Mama. At the end, as in the beginning she says, "But first and foremost, I remember Mama."
